title: 111_s18
content: The Act titled "No Entry for Supporters of the Iranian Regime Act of 2010" prohibits certain aliens who engage in activities with respect to Iran from being admitted into the country. The Act "No Entry for Supporters of the Iranian Regime Act of 2010" prohibits aliens engaging in activities with Iran from being admitted into the country, as per an amendment to the Immigration and Nationality Act. The Iran Sanctions Act of 1996 (Public Law 104-172; 50 U.S.C. 1701 note) includes provisions regarding activities related to Iran. The Iran Sanctions Act of 1996 includes provisions for sanctions on Iran's proliferation of weapons of mass destruction or means of delivery, as outlined in Executive Order 13382. The curr_chunk specifies activities related to support for international terrorism by the Government of Iran, for which sanctions can be imposed under Executive Order 13224. The curr_chunk outlines activities related to Iran for which sanctions may be imposed, including involvement in entities engaging in such activities or being related to individuals involved in supporting international terrorism by the Government of Iran. The curr_chunk discusses aliens or individuals in charge of entities engaging in activities related to Iran for which sanctions may be imposed. The Secretary of State may notify an alien of potential inadmissibility and reasons for it. The President can waive this and admit the alien under certain conditions. The President can waive inadmissibility for an alien if the entity has stopped the activity or taken steps to stop it, and reliable assurances have been received. The Secretary of Homeland Security must issue regulations within 180 days regarding the inadmissibility of aliens who engage in certain sanctionable activities with Iran.
